column4: hi .. I have a Q .. what does it mean when I try installing a package and it says that some  packages have unresolvable dependencies ? how can I fix that ?
hi .. I have a Q .. what does it mean when I try installing a package and it says that some  packages have unresolvable dependencies ? how can I fix that ?
it means the package you are trying to install depends on some other package that the package manager cant find, you can try to install the dependency manually to solve.
thanks for the reply :), how can I install it manually ?
what are you trying to install specifically and waht does it tell you is missing?

.. I ran a partial upgrade and restarted and suddenly GIMP wasn't there :| .. ! I tried installing it again from the package manager and it told me about 2 unresolvable dependencies .. and I checked all repo's were enabled ..
it didnt specify which packages it needed?
.. it did .. 2 packages
ok but what are they named?
libgimp2.0 (>=2.4.6) but 2.4.5-1ubuntu2 and  libpango1.0-0 (>=1.20.5) but 1.20.1-1
apt-cache search libgimp
tell me if it returns anything relevant?
anirud0 : I'm kind of an intermediate user and I'm not sure about what ur saying the custom repos .. :$
: ok hold on
sudo apt-get install libgimp2.0 libpango1.0-0
: about the apt-cache .. I didn't get anything relevant .. just normal stuff I'm guessing
sudo apt-get install libgimp2.0 libpango1.0-0
try installing gimp after you install those two packages
: the output states that the libgimp have unmet dependencies and that libpango is already newest version
I have a feeling there is something wrong with your repos, what did you upgrade from/to?
.. I'm using Hardy Heron .. an update reminder requested a partial upgrade so I just did it .. and restarted ..
pm me
I just did
